pr_title: Add warnings for invalid realm order config (#51195)

timeline.message:
Add warnings for invalid realm order config (#51195)

Issue warnings for both missing realm order and duplicated realm orders.
The changes are to help users prepare for migration to next major
release.

timeline.bodyText: Not sure what url should be used here. The breaking change page will only be available once 8.0 is released?
timeline.author: ywangd

replies.bodyText: There should be a link to the deprecation snippet, which is still to be added in this PR, seee my other comment #51515 (comment) .
replies.author: albertzaharovits

timeline.bodyText: I think you want to use Settings.hasValue instead here.
timeline.author: tvernum

timeline.bodyText:
We would typically refer to the whole setting key in these sorts of deprecation warnings.

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                            .map(e -> e.getKey().getName())
          
          
            
                            .map(e -> RealmSettings.realmSettingPrefix(e.getKey()) + RealmSettings.ORDER_SETTING_KEY)
timeline.author: tvernum

timeline.bodyText: I'd prefer to collect them in a Set instead of a String. No signficant reason, it just seems "cleaner" to me.
timeline.author: tvernum

timeline.bodyText: Per comments on the PR itself, we'll need to provide a URL here.
timeline.author: tvernum

replies.bodyText: Updated the doc file and added the corresponding URL here.
replies.author: ywangd

timeline.bodyText: I'd like an inverse test as well - that realms with an order don't trigger an issue.
timeline.author: tvernum

replies.bodyText: Added one test for correct realm order configs (2 realms of different orders)
replies.author: ywangd

timeline.bodyText: Can we add another realm with order + 1 and verify that it isn't reported.
timeline.author: tvernum

replies.bodyText: Yes we should. The test cases are not exhaustive. I have updated them to have better coverage.
replies.author: ywangd

timeline.bodyText: One comment if we keep this: Generally we create one static DeprecationLogger for each class similar to the regular logger. It's not too much overhead to create new ones but it's still creating a few unnecessary objects.
